Package edu.uky.cs.nil.sabre

Class Universe

java.lang.Object
edu.uky.cs.nil.sabre.Universe
All Implemented Interfaces:
Serializable, Function<Object,Object>
public class Universe extends Object implements Function<Object,Object>, Serializable
A universe is the collection of all the things in a planning problem, specifically all the entities and the types of those entities. A universe provides a way to look up types and entities by name and to efficiently query type relationships, like whether one type is a subtype of another, whether an entity is of a type, and which entities are of a type.

A universe is an immutable object; types and entities cannot be added or removed. To modify a universe, use a UniverseBuilder to make a copy of a universe that reflects the desired changes.

Author:
Stephen G. Ware
See Also:

  • Constructor Details

    • Universe

      public Universe()
      Constructs a default "empty" universe. The default universe has four types defined: boolean, number, entity, and character. It contains no entities, though some values, such as true and false and numbers are always defined and not associated with any specific universe.

    • is

      public boolean is(Type child, Type parent)
      Tests whether one type is a subtype of another. This method runs in constant time.
      Parameters:
      child - the type which might be a subtype of the parent
      parent - the type which might be a supertype of the child
      Returns:
      true if child is the same type as or a subtype of the parent, false otherwise

    • is

      public boolean is(Entity entity, Type type)
      Tests whether an entity is of a given type. This method runs in constant time.
      Parameters:
      entity - the entity which might be of the given type
      type - the type
      Returns:
      true if the entity is of that type, false otherwise

    • getDefaultValue

      public Value getDefaultValue(Type type)
      Returns the default value that a fluent of the given type will have when it has not been explicitly assigned a value. By default, boolean fluents are false, numbers are zero, and entities are unknown.
      Parameters:
      type - the type whose default value is desired
      Returns:
      the default value

    • getValues

      public ImmutableSet<Value> getValues(Type type)
      Returns a set of all values that are of the given type. If the type given is boolean, the list will always be \{false, true\}. If the type given is a subtype of entity, all relevant entities will be returned. If the type given is number, an exception will be thrown, since there are infinitely many values of that type.
      Parameters:
      type - the type
      Returns:
      a set of values of that type
      Throws:
      FormatException - if the type given is number

    • getIntersection

      public ImmutableSet<Value> getIntersection(Type first, Type second)
      Returns a set of values which are of both given types.
      Parameters:
      first - the first type
      second - the second type
      Returns:
      a set of values both both types
      Throws:
      FormatException - if both types given are number

    • intersects

      public boolean intersects(Type first, Type second)
      Tests whether any values exist which are of both types.
      Parameters:
      first - the first type
      second - the second type
      Returns:
      true if at least one value exists which is of both types, false otherwise
